commits.commitMessage:
[LE-14332] Replace tinyDTLS RNG

Replace use of libc rand() in dtls_prng* with
the secure RNG provided by rng_gen_random()

Relates: LE-14332
Resolves: LE-15878
Change-Id: I9aa83d4f8a3292dee9b7ab374b318d9457f8a815
Signed-off-by: Gavin Acquroff <gacquroff@sierrawireless.com>
(cherry picked from commit 06fbd0c8fd6a0d6daa8c2fba805e62f7627cbc2a)
commits.subject: [LE-14332] Replace tinyDTLS RNG

commits.commitMessage:
Fix broken make rules resulting in broken build.

Ran into this compiling under Yocto 2.6

* doc/Makefile.in (install): The install target depends on a
prerequisite called html, but html is not the target of any rule.
If it doesn't exist, make will bail with an error message that there is
no rule to make html.  html is a directory that is made as a side effect
of some other rule.  Somehow, this side effect of html/ coming into
existence is not happening in my environment, and so if I remove this
html prerequisite so that the rule actually runs, the cp -r html/*
fails. Putting a defensive if around it.

Resolves: LE-12470
Change-Id: I616a43fb5654e1ab997999ea99c944e1fd8ecade
Signed-off-by: Kaz Kylheku <kkylheku@sierrawireless.com>
commits.subject: Fix broken make rules resulting in broken build.

commits.commitMessage:
Fix broken make rules resulting in broken build.

Ran into this compiling under Yocto 2.6

* doc/Makefile.in (install): The install target depends on a
prerequisite called html, but html is not the target of any rule.
If it doesn't exist, make will bail with an error message that there is
no rule to make html.  html is a directory that is made as a side effect
of some other rule.  Somehow, this side effect of html/ coming into
existence is not happening in my environment, and so if I remove this
html prerequisite so that the rule actually runs, the cp -r html/*
fails. Putting a defensive if around it.

Resolves: LE-12470
Change-Id: I850c1ed258669a7c5d3d395cffb426fac838a296
Signed-off-by: Kaz Kylheku <kkylheku@sierrawireless.com>
commits.subject: Fix broken make rules resulting in broken build.
